tuv.seg: The Education (Welfare) Act 2000 sets out the law in relation to discipline in State primary and post-primary schools
Leagann an tAcht Oideachais (Leas) 2000 amach an dlí in Éirinn maidir le smacht sna bunscoileanna agus iarbhunscoileanna Stáit
Under the Act the board of management of the school is obliged to draw up a code of behaviour for students stating the disciplinary rules and procedures
Faoin Acht, tá dualgas ar bhord bainistíochta na scoile cód iompraíochta a leagan amach ag sonrú na rialacha agus nósanna imeachta smachta
Codes are drawn up with input from teachers, parents and the educational welfare officer
Leagtar cóid amach le hionchur na múinteoirí, na dtuismitheoirí agus an oifigigh leasa oideachais
(Educational welfare officers work for the Child and Family Agency and they help co-ordinate all policies concerning both attendance and broader educational welfare.)

(Oibríonn na hoifigigh leasa oideachais leis an Ghníomhaireacht um Leanaí agus an Teaghlach agus cuidíonn siad le comhordú na bpolasaithe ar fad maidir le tinreamh agus leas oideachais níos leithne araon)
A code of behaviour must lay down the:
Caithfidh cód iompraíochta a leagan síos:
• Types of behaviour by the student that may need disciplinary measures
• Na cineálacha iompraíochta ón mac léinn a mbeadh bearta smachta riachtanach maidir leo
• Nature of the disciplinary measures to be carried out
• Cineál na mbeart smachta le comhlíonadh
• Procedures to be followed before a student is suspended or expelled
• Nósanna imeachta le leanúint sula gcuirtear mac léinn ar fionraí nó é/í a dhíbirt
• Grounds for lifting a suspension
• Cúiseanna le fionraí a chur i leataobh
There are Guidelines for Schools on Developing a Code of Behaviour (pdf) and information about the Guidelines on the Agency's website on the Agency's website
Tá tuilleadh eolais faoi na Treoirlínte i gComhair Scoileanna ar Chód Íompar a Fhorbairt (pdf) agus na Treoirlínte ar fáil ar an suíomh gréasáin an Ghníomhaireacht um Leanaí agus an Teaghlach

When a child is becoming a student at the school, the principal must give a copy of the code to the parents and may require that the parents agree to make all reasonable efforts to ensure that the child complies with the code

Nuair atá leanbh ag tosú mar mhac léinn sa scoil, caithfidh an príomhoide cóip den chód a thabhairt do na tuismitheoirí agus d'fhéadfadh riachtanas a bheith ar na tuismitheoirí aontú gach iarracht a dhéanamh a chinntiú go gcloíonn an leanbh leis an gcód
Department of Education and Skills guidelines recommend that the prevention of bullying should be a fundamental part of a written code of behaviour and discipline in all schools
Molann treoirlínte na Roinne Oideachais agus Scileanna gur chóir go mbeadh cosc ar bhulaíocht mar pháirt lárnach de chód scríofa iompraíochta agus smachta i ngach scoil
Schools have considerable independence in the area of discipline
Tá mórán neamhspleáchais ag scoileanna i réimse na smachta
However, they must use fair procedures
Caithfidh siad, áfach, nósanna imeachta atá cóir a úsáid
This includes hearing the student's case
Cuimsíonn sé seo éisteacht le cás an mhic léinn
Most schools already have a code of behaviour that sets out how students will punished for breaching it
Tá cód iompraíochta ag an gcuid is mó de scoileanna anois a leagann amach conas mar a chuirtear pionós ar mhic léinn nuair a sháraítear an cód
It is assumed that parents agree to the punishments set out in the code if they are told about the code when their child starts school
Glactar leis go n-aontaíonn na tuismitheoirí leis na pionóis leagtha amach sa chód má tá an méid seo ráite leo nuair a thosaíonn an leanbh ar scoil
As a result, if the punishment is detention, the parents or student cannot claim that the student has been falsely imprisoned
Dá thoradh seo, más coinneáil istigh atá mar phionós, ní féidir leis na tuismitheoirí ná an mac léinn éileamh go ndearnadh iad a phríosúnú go héagórach
If there has been serious misbehaviour, the school may decide to suspend a student
Dá mbeadh an mí-iompar go trom, feadfadh an scoil cinneadh ar fhionraíocht an dhalta
This decision is made only after all other disciplinary measures have been tried
Déanfar an cinneadh nuair a tabharfar faoi gach eile beart smachta
The school will notify the parents of the suspension
Tabhairfaidh an scoil fógra do na thuismitheoirí
The parents may appeal this decision to the board of management and as a last resort to the Department of Education and Skills
Is féidir le tuismitheoir achomharc a dhéanamh leis an mbord bainistíochta agus mar rogha dheiridh leis an Roinn Oideachais agus agus Scileanna
Before a student is expelled, the educational welfare officer must be told
Sula ndéantar mac léinn a dhíbirt, caithfear an méid sin a insint don oifigeach leasa oideachais
The educational welfare officer may then try to find a solution
D'fhéadfadh an t-oifigeach leasa oideachais ansin iarracht a dhéanamh teacht ar réiteach
The student cannot be expelled until 20 days after the educational welfare officer has been notified about the case
Ní féidir an mac léinn a dhíbirt go dtí 20 lá tar éis fógra a thabhairt don oifigeach leasa oideachais faoin gcás

Under the Education Act 1998 the Minister can, after consultations with the education partners, set out procedures whereby a parent can appeal against a decision of a teacher or other staff member to the board of management

Faoin Acht Oideachais 1998, is féidir leis an Aire Oideachais agus Scileanna, tar éis comhairliú leis na comhpháirtithe oideachais, nósanna imeachta a leagan amach inar féidir le tuismitheoir achomharc a dhéanamh leis an mBord Bainistíochta
These procedures can also be used by parents or students who have complaints (except for expulsions)
Ní féidir na nósanna imeachta seo a úsáid ach amháin maidir le tuismitheoirí nó mic léinn a bhfuil gearáin acu (lasmuigh de dhíbirtí)
Appeals to the Department of Education and Skills
Achomhairc chuig an Roinn Oideachais agus Scileanna

Under Section 29 of the Education Act 1998 if a Board of Management expels a student or suspends a student or refuses to enrol a student then the parent may appeal that decision to the Secretary General of the Department of Education and Skills (DES) and the appeal will be heard by an appeals committee - see 'How to apply' below

Faoi Alt 29 den Acht Oideachais 1998 má dhíbríonn bord bainistíochta mac léinn nó má chuirtear mac léinn ar fionraí nó má dhiúltaítear mac léinn a chlárú, is féidir leis an tuismitheoir ansin achomharc a dhéanamh ar an gcinneadh chuig Ard-Rúnaí na Roinne Oideachais agus Scileanna. Cloisfidh coiste achomhairc an t-achomharc
The procedures for the hearing of appeals must ensure that:
Caithfidh na nósanna imeachta d'éisteacht na n-achomharc a chinntiú:
• The parties are helped to reach agreement, if possible
• Go gcuidítear leis na páirtithe teacht ar chomhaontú, más féidir
• The appeal is conducted in the most informal way possible
• Go stiúraítear an t-achomharc ar an mbealach is neamhfhoirmeálta is féidir
• Appeals are dealt with within 30 days, but the Secretary General may extend the time by a further 14 days
• Déileáiltear le hachomhairc laistigh de 30 lá, ach is féidir leis an Ard-Rúnaí 14 lá breise a chur leis an tréimhse seo
If the appeals committee upholds a complaint or believes that a matter arose that needs to be remedied, it must make recommendations to the Secretary General about the action required
Má sheasann an coiste achomharc le gearán nó má chreideann siad gur tháinig ceist aníos is gá a réiteach, caithfidh sé moltaí a dhéanamh chuig an Ard-Rúnaí faoin ngníomh atá ag teastáil
The Secretary General must give reasons for the decision of the appeals committee and, if it has made a recommendation, may give directions to the board on how to resolve the issue

Caithfidh an tArd-Rúnaí cúiseanna a thabhairt le cinneadh an choiste achomharc agus, má tá moladh déanta aige, d'fhéadfaí treoracha a thabhairt don Bhord ar an mbealach is fearr leis an gceist a réiteach
The Child and Family Agency has the right to appeal in cases where the board of management expels a student or refuses to enrol a student
Tá ceart ag an Ghníomhaireacht um Leanaí agus an Teaghlach achomharc a dhéanamh i gcásanna nuair a dhíbríonn an bord bainistíochta mac léinn nó go ndiúltaíonn siad mac léinn a chlárú
In cases where the parent appeals the Agency is able to make submissions to the appeals committee
Tá an Ghníomhaireacht um Leanaí agus an Teaghlach ábalta aighneachtaí a dhéanamh chomh maith ar an gcoiste achomharc i gcásanna ina ndéanann tuismitheoir achomharc
The Education (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2007 (pdf), which is not yet in effect, amends Section 29 of the Education Act
Leasóidh an tAcht Oideachais (Forálacha Ilghnéitheacha) 2007 (pdf), nach bhfuil curtha éifeacht fós, in Alt 29 den Acht Oideachais

Its provisions will require the appeals committee when they are deciding a case to take account of the educational interests of other students in the school as well as those of the student who is the subject of the appeal

Cuirfidh na forálacha dualgas ar an gcoiste achomharc nuair atá cinneadh maidir le cás á dhéanamh, leasanna oideachais na mac léinn eile sa scoil a mheabhrú chomh maith leis an mac léinn atá mar ábhar an achomhairc
The Act will also entitle the National Council for Special Education to make submissions to an appeals committee
Faoin Acht freisin beidh an Chomhairle Náisiúnta um Oideachas Speisialta i dteideal aighneacht chuig cóiste achomhairc a dhéanamh
Under Section 24 of the Non-Fatal Offences Against the Person Act 1997, corporal punishment of students may be a crime
Faoi Alt 24 den Acht um Chionta Neamh-Mharfacha in aghaidh an Duine 1997, d'fhéadfadh gur coir a bheadh i gceist le pionós corportha ar mhic léinn
However, Sections 18 and 20 of the Act permit the justifiable use of force in certain circumstances, for example, self defence or defence of others
Ceadaíonn Altanna 18 agus 20 den Acht, áfach, úsáid inchosanta fórsa i gcúinsí áirithe, mar shampla, féinchosaint nó daoine eile a chosaint

School discipline in primary schools is also regulated by the Department's Guidelines towards a Postive Policy for School Behaviour and Discipline which contains a Suggested Code of Behaviour and Discipline for National Schools and Rule 130 (as amended by Circular 7/88) of the Rules for National Schools

Tá smacht scoile sna bunscoileanna rialaithe chomh maith ag Treoirlínte i dtreo Polasaí Dearfach d'Iompraíocht agus Smacht Scoile na Roinne a chuimsíonn Cód Inmholta Iompraíochta agus Smachta do Scoileanna Náisiúnta agus Riail 130 (mar a leasaíodh in Imlitir 7/88) de Rialacha na Scoileanna Náisiúnta
Discipline in second-level schools is also regulated by the Department's Guidelines Towards a Positive Policy for School Behaviour and Discipline
Tá smacht sna scoileanna dara leibhéal rialaithe chomh maith ag Treoirlínte i dtreo Polasaí Dearfach d'Iompraíocht agus Smacht Scoile na Roinne
It contains a suggested code of discipline and was circulated to the management of all post-primary schools in 1991
Cuimsíonn siad cód inmholta smachta agus scaipeadh iad ar bhainistíocht na scoileanna iarbhunscolaíochta i 1991
National Behaviour Support Service
Seirbhís Náisiúnta Tacaíochta Iompraíochta
In 2006 a National Behaviour Support Service (NBSS) was set up to help second-level schools deal with disruptive behaviour
Tá Seirbhís Náisiúnta Tacaíochta Iompraíochta bhunaithe chun cuidiú le scoileanna déileáil le hiompraíocht thoirmeascach
The service works with selected schools that have significant discipline problems
Tá an tSeirbhís seo ar fáil do scoileanna dara leibhéal indibhidiúla a bhfuil fadhbanna smachta móra acu
The NBSS operates through 4 regional behaviour support teams
Oibríonn an tSeirbhís seo i gceithre fhoireann tacaíochta iompraíochta ar bhonn réigiúnach
A team of professionals, including psychologists, works intensively with a school over a period of time to help identify the school's problems and improve student behaviour
Oibríonn foireann de dhaoine gairmiúla go dian, síceolaithe ina measc, thar thréimhse ama chun cuidiú le fadhbanna na scoile a aithint agus iompraíocht na mac léinn a fheabhsú
In some cases the team may recommend setting up a behaviour support classroom in a school
I gcásanna áirithe, d'fhéadfadh an fhoireann moladh a dhéanamh seomra ranga tacaíochta iompraíochta a bhunú sa scoil

Information about appeals to the Secretary General under Section 29 of the Education Act 1998 can be found on the Department of Education and Skills (DES) website including Circulars 22/02 (primary schools) and M48/01 (post-primary schools) and the DES document on appeals procedures (pdf)

Tá tuilleadh eolais faoi achomhairc chuig Ard-Rúnaí faoi Alt 29 den Acht Oideachais 1998 ar an suíomh gréasáin na Roinne Oideachais agus Scileanna (ROE) lena n-áirítear Ciorcláin 22/02 (bunscoileanna) agus M48/01 (scoileanna dara-leibhéil) agus sa doiciméad ROE faoi nósanna imeachta achomhairc
If you are making an appeal you should complete the appeals application form and send it to the Appeals Administration Unit of the Department of Education and Skills - see 'Where to apply' below

Chun achomharc a dhéanamh ba chóir duit an fhoirm iarratas a chomhlánú agus í a sheoladh don Rannóg Riaracháin Achomhairc den Roinn Oideachais agus Scileanna - féach 'Cá háit a dhéanfaidh mé iarratas' thios
